questions.question: In the experiment to determine the energy band gap of a semiconductor diode by changing the temperature while keeping the biasing voltage constant, which property will be measured?
The energy band gap of a semiconductor diode is the energy difference between:
When sufficient energy is provided by increasing the temperatue in the vicinity of semiconductor diode, what happens to electrons in the material?

answers.a: Electrons move to the conduction band.
answers.b: Electrons move to the valence band.
answers.c: Electrons remain in the forbidden band.
answers.d: Electrons are emitted from the diode.

questions.question: What is the purpose of keeping the biasing voltage constant during the experiment?

answers.a: To prevent overheating of the diode
answers.b: To ensure a constant initial current flows through the diode
answers.c: To maintain a constant temperature in the setup
answers.d: To reduce the complexity of the experiment

questions.question: How does the energy band gap of a semiconductor diode affect its electrical conductivity with increasing temperature?

answers.d: Conductivity is independent of the energy band gap.
